description: Site of Roman barrow burials excavated in mid 18th century and 1950s. Post holes suggested that an enclosure was built around the barrow, along with structured-deposits, this has led the structure to be identified as a shrine.
bibliography: Jessup. “Excavation of a Roman Barrow at Holborough, Snodland.” Archaeologia Cantiana 68 (1954).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Holborough, Snodland (Kent).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
